hymns.title: Hear What the Voice from Heav'n Proclaims

verses.html:
1
Hear what the voice from heav’n proclaims,
For all the pious dead: “Sweet is the savor
of their names, And soft their sleeping bed.”
verses.updatedHtml:
1
Hear what the voice from heav’n proclaims,
For all the pious dead: “Sweet is the savor
of their names, And soft their sleeping bed.”

verses.html:
2
“They die in Jesus and are blest;
How kind their slumbers are!
From suffering and from sin released,
They’re freed from ev’ry snare.
verses.updatedHtml:
2
“They die in Jesus and are blest;
How kind their slumbers are!
From suff'ring and from sins released,
And freed from ev’ry snare.

verses.html:
3
Far from this world of toil and strife,
They’re present with the Lord;
The labors of their mortal life
End in a large reward.“
verses.updatedHtml:
3
Far from this world of toil and strife,
They’re present with the Lord;
The labors of their mortal life
End in a large reward.

verses.html:
1
Father, let me dedicate
All this year to Thee,
In whatever wordly state
Thou wouldst have me be;
Not from sorrow, pain, or care
Freedom dare I claim;
This alone shall be my prayer “Glorify Thy name.”
verses.updatedHtml:
1
Father, let me dedicate
All this year to Thee,
In whatever wordly state
Thou wilt have me be;
Not from sorrow, pain, or care,
Freedom dare I claim;
This alone shall be my prayer “Glorify Thy name.”

verses.html:
2
Can a child presume to choose
Where or how to live?
Can a father’s love refuse
All the best to give?
More Thou givest every day
Than the best can claim;
Nor with holdest aught that may
Glorify Thy name.
verses.updatedHtml:
2
Can a child presume to choose
Where or how to live?
Can a Father's love refuse
All the best to give?
More Thou givest ev'ry day
Than the best can claim;
Nor withholdest aught that may
Glorify Thy name.

verses.html:
3
If Thou callest to the cross,
And its shadow come,
Turning all my gain to loss,
Shrouding heart and home:
Let me think how Thy dear Son
To His glory came,
And in deepest woe pray on, “Glorify Thy name.”
verses.updatedHtml:
3
If Thou callest to the cross,
And its shadow come,
Turning all my gain to loss,
Shrouding heart and home;
Let me think how Thy dear Son
To His glory came,
And in deepest woe pray on, “Glorify Thy name.”

verses.html:
4
If in mercy Thou wilt spare
Joys that yet are mine,
If on life, serene and fair,
Brighter rays may shine,
Let my glad heart, while it sings,
Thee in all proclaim;
And whate’er the future brings,
Glorify Thy name.
verses.updatedHtml:
4
If in mercy Thou wilt spare
Joys that yet are mine,
If on life, serene and fair,
Brighter rays may shine;
Let my glad heart, while it sings,
Thee in all proclaim;
And whate’er the future brings,
Glorify Thy name.

verses.html:
1
Fade, fade each earthly
joy; Jesus is mine.
Break every tender tie;
Jesus is mine.
Dark is the wilderness,
Earth has no resting place,
Jesus alone can bless;
Jesus is mine.
verses.updatedHtml:
1
Fade, fade each earthly
joy; Jesus is mine.
Break ev'ry tender tie;
Jesus is mine.
Dark is the wilderness,
Earth has no resting place,
Jesus alone can bless;
Jesus is mine.

verses.html:
2
Tempt not my soul away;
Jesus is mine.
Here would I ever stay;
Jesus is mine.
Perishing things of clay,
Born but for one brief day,
Pass from my heart away;
Jesus is mine.
verses.updatedHtml:
2
Tempt not my soul away;
Jesus is mine.
Here would I ever stay;
Jesus is mine.
Perishing things of clay,
Born but for one brief day,
Pass from my heart away;
Jesus is mine.

verses.html:
3
Farewell, ye dreams of night;
Jesus is mine.
Lost in this dawning light;
Jesus is mine.
All that my soul has tried
Left but a dismal void;
Jesus has satisfied;
Jesus is mine.
verses.updatedHtml:
3
Farewell, ye dreams of night;
Jesus is mine.
Lost in this dawning light;
Jesus is mine.
All that my soul has tried
Left but a dismal void;
Jesus has satisfied;
Jesus is mine.

verses.html:
4
Farewell, mortality;
Jesus is mine.
Welcome, eternity;
Jesus is mine.
Welcome, O loved and blest;
Welcome, sweet scenes of rest,
Welcome, my Saviour’s breast;
Jesus is mine.
verses.updatedHtml:
4
Farewell, mortality;
Jesus is mine.
Welcome, eternity;
Jesus is mine.
Welcome, O loved and blest;
Welcome, sweet scenes of rest,
Welcome, my Saviour’s breast;
Jesus is mine.

hymns.title: Here from the World We Turn

verses.html:
1
Here from the world we turn,
Jesus to seek;
Here may His loving voice
Tenderly speak!
Jesus, our dearest friend,
While at Thy feet we bend,
O let Thy smile descend! ’Tis Thee we seek.
verses.updatedHtml:
1
Here from the world we turn,
Jesus to seek;
Here may His loving voice
Tenderly speak!
Jesus, our dearest friend,
While at Thy feet we bend,
O let Thy smile descend! ’Tis Thee we seek.

verses.html:
2
Come, Holy Comforter,
Presence Divine,
Now in our longing hearts
Graciously shine,
O for Thy mighty power!
O for a blessed shower,
Filling this hallowed hour
With joy divine!
verses.updatedHtml:
2
Come, Holy Comforter,
Presence Divine,
Now in our longing hearts
Graciously shine,
O for Thy mighty pow'r!
O for a blessed show'r,
Filling this hallowed hour
With joy divine!

verses.html:
3
Saviour, Thy work revive:
Here may we see
Those who are dead in sin
Quickened by Thee;
Come to our hearts tonight,
Make every burden light,
Cheer Thou our waiting sight;
We long for Thee.
verses.updatedHtml:
3
Saviour, Thy work revive;
Here may we see
Those who are dead in sin
Quickened by Thee;
Come to our hearts tonight,
Make ev'ry burden light;
Cheer Thou our waiting sight;
We long for Thee.

verses.html:
1
I’ve wandered far away from God,
Now I’m coming home;
The paths of sin too long I’ve trod,
Lord, I’m coming home.

hymns.title: Take Me, O My Father, Take Me

verses.html:
1
Take me, O my Father, take me!
Take me, save me, thro’ Thy son;
That which Thee wouldst have me, make me,
Let Thy will in me be done.
verses.updatedHtml:
1
Take me, O my Father, take me!
Take me, save me, thro’ Thy son;
That which Thee wouldst have me, make me,
Let Thy will in me be done.

verses.label: 1C
verses.html:
1
Long from Thee my footsteps straying,
Thorny proved the way I trod;
Weary come I now, and praying,
Take me to Thy love, my God!
verses.updatedHtml:
1
Long from Thee my footsteps straying,
Thorny proved the way I trod;
Weary come I now, and praying,
Take me to Thy love, my God!

verses.html:
2
Fruitless years with grief recalling,
Humbly I confess my sin;
At Thy feet, O Father, falling,
To Thy household take me in.
verses.updatedHtml:
2
Fruitless years with grief recalling,
Humbly I confess my sin;
At Thy feet, O Father, falling,
To Thy household take me in.

verses.label: 2C
verses.html:
2
Freely now to Thee I proffer
This repenting heart of mine;
Freely life and soul I offer,
Gift unworthy love like Thine.
verses.updatedHtml:
2
Freely now to Thee I proffer
This repenting heart of mine;
Freely life and soul I offer,
Gift unworthy love like Thine.

verses.html:
3
Once the world’s Redeemer dying
Bare our sins upon the tree;
On that Sacrifice relying,
Now I look in hope to Thee:
verses.updatedHtml:
3
Once the world’s Redeemer dying
Bare our sins upon the tree;
On that Sacrifice relying,
Now I look in hope to Thee:

verses.label: 3C
verses.html:
3
Father, take me! allforgiving,
Fold me to Thy loving breast;
In Thy love for ever living,
I must be forever blessed!
verses.updatedHtml:
3
Father, take me! allforgiving,
Fold me to Thy loving breast;
In Thy love for ever living,
I must be forever blessed!

verses.html:
1
Time now has passed; hail the New Year!
Saints at God’s throne are gathered here,
Worshiping Him with thanks we sing
Praises ascend to Christ our King.
verses.updatedHtml:
1
Time now has passed; hail the New Year!
Saints at God’s throne are gathered here,
Worshiping Him with thanks we sing
Praises ascend to Christ our King.

verses.html:
2
Father we thank Thee for past care,
Blessing and guiding thro’ the year.
Take now this year, show us Thy way,
Keep us from straying, Lord, we pray.
verses.updatedHtml:
2
Father we thank Thee for past care,
Blessing and guiding thro’ the year.
Take now this year, show us Thy way,
Keep us from straying, Lord, we pray.

verses.html:
3
Father, protect us from all wrong.
Thee would we serve helping the throng.
Grant us the wisdom and the pow’r,
Thy will to do each passing hour.
verses.updatedHtml:
3
Father, protect us from all wrong.
Thee would we serve helping the throng.
Grant us the wisdom and the pow’r,
Thy will to do each passing hour.

verses.html:
4
Dear Lord, increase our faith each day
To higher planes lift us we pray.
We place our work within Thy hand
O, give us peace! Revive again.
verses.updatedHtml:
4
Dear Lord, increase our faith each day

We place our work within Thy hand

verses.html:
1
Come, ye thankful people, come,
Raise the song of harvest home!
All is safely gathered in,
Ere the winter storms begin;
God, our Maker, doth provide
For our wants to be supplied:
Come to God’s own temple, come,
Raise the song of harvest home.
verses.updatedHtml:
1
Come, ye thankful people, come,
Raise the song of harvest home!
All is safely gathered in,
Ere the winter storms begin;
God, our Maker, doth provide
For our wants to be supplied:
Come to God’s own temple, come,
Raise the song of harvest home.

verses.html:
2
We ourselves are God’s own field,
Fruit unto His praise to yield:
Wheat and tares together sown
Unto joy or sorrow grown;
First the blade, and then the ear,
Then the full corn shall appear;
Lord of harvest! grant that we
Wholesome grain and pure may be.
verses.updatedHtml:
2
We ourselves are God’s own field,
Fruit unto His praise to yield:
Wheat and tares together sown
Unto joy or sorrow grown;
First the blade, and then the ear,
Then the full corn shall appear;
Lord of harvest! grant that we
Wholesome grain and pure may be.

verses.html:
3
For the Lord our God shall come,
And shall take His harvest home;
From His field shall purge away
All that doth offend that day;
Give His angels charge at last
In the fire the tares to cast;
But the fruitful ears to store
In His garner evermore.
verses.updatedHtml:
3
For the Lord our God shall come,
And shall take His harvest home;
From His field shall purge away
All that doth offend that day;
Give His angels charge at last
In the fire the tares to cast;
But the fruitful ears to store
In His garner evermore.

verses.html:
4
Even so, Lord, quickly come,
To Thy final harvest home;
Gather Thou Thy people in,
Free from sorrow, free from sin;
There, forever purified,
In Thy pressence to abide:
Come, with all Thine angels, come,
Raise the glorious harvest home!
verses.updatedHtml:
4

hymns.title: All Creatures of Our God and King

verses.html:
1
All creatures of our God and King,
Lift up your voice and with us
Sing Alleluia! Alleluia!
verses.updatedHtml:
1
All creatures of our God and King,
Lift up your voice and with us
Sing Alleluia! Alleluia!

verses.label: 1C
verses.html:
1
Thou burning sun with golden
beam, Thou silver moon with softer gleam!
O praise Him! O praise Him!
Alleluia! Alleluia! Alleluia!
verses.updatedHtml:
1
Thou burning sun with golden
beam, Thou silver moon with softer gleam!

verses.html:
2

O praise Him! Alleluia!

2

verses.label: 2C

hymns.title: Brethren, We Have Met to Worship

verses.html:
1
Brethren, we have met to worship
And adore the Lord our God;
Will you pray with all your power,
While we try to preach the Word?
verses.updatedHtml:
1
Brethren, we have met to worship
And adore the Lord our God;
Will you pray with all your power,
While we try to preach the Word?

verses.label: 1C
verses.html:
1
All is vain unless the Spirit
Of the Holy One comes down;
Brethren, pray, and holy manna
Will be showered all around.
verses.updatedHtml:
1
All is vain unless the Spirit
Of the Holy One comes down;
Brethren, pray, and holy manna
Will be showered all around.

verses.html:
2
Brethren, see poor sinners round you
Slumb’ring on the brink of woe;
Death is coming, hell is moving,
Can you bear to let them go?
verses.updatedHtml:
2
Brethren, see poor sinners round you
Slumb’ring on the brink of woe;
Death is coming, hell is moving,
Can you bear to let them go?

verses.label: 2C
verses.html:
2
See our fathers and our mothers,
And our children sinking down;
Brethren, pray, and holy manna
Will be showered all around.
verses.updatedHtml:
2
See our fathers and our mothers,
And our children sinking down;
Brethren, pray, and holy manna
Will be showered all around.

verses.html:
3
Sisters, will you join and help us?
Moses’ sister aided him;
Will you help the trembling mourners
Who are struggling hard with sin?
verses.updatedHtml:
3
Sisters, will you join and help us?
Moses’ sister aided him;
Will you help the trembling mourners
Who are struggling hard with sin?

verses.label: 3C
verses.html:
3
Tell them all about the Saviour,
Tell them that He will be found;
Sisters, pray, and holy manna
Will be showered all around.
verses.updatedHtml:
3
Tell them all about the Saviour,
Tell them that He will be found;
Sisters, pray, and holy manna
Will be showered all around.

verses.html:
4
Let us love our God supremely,
Let us love each other too;
Let us love and pray for sinners,
Till our God makes all things new.
verses.updatedHtml:
4
Let us love our God supremely,
Let us love each other too;
Let us love and pray for sinners,
Till our God makes all things new.

verses.label: 4C
verses.html:
4
Then He’ll call us home to heaven,
At His table we’ll sit down;
Christ will gird Himself, and serve us
With sweet manna all around.
verses.updatedHtml:
4

hymns.title: The Light of the World Is Jesus

verses.html:
1
The whole world was lost in the darkness of sin,
The Light of the world is Jesus;
Like sunshine at noonday His glory shone in,
The Light of the world is Jesus.
verses.updatedHtml:
1
The whole world was lost in the darkness of sin,
The Light of the world is Jesus;
Like sunshine at noonday His glory shone in,
The Light of the world is Jesus.

verses.label: 1C
verses.html:
1
Come to the Light, ’tis shining for thee;
Sweetly the Light has dawned upon me,
Once I was blind, but now I can see;
The Light of the world is Jesus.

verses.html:

The Light of the world is Jesus;
We walk in the light when we follow our guide,
The Light of the world is Jesus.

verses.html:
1
Jesus calls us o’er the tumult
Of our life’s wild, restless sea;
Day by day His sweet voice soundeth,
Saying, “Christian, follow me!”
verses.updatedHtml:
1
Jesus calls us o’er the tumult
Of our life’s wild, restless sea;
Day by day His sweet voice soundeth,
Saying, “Christian, follow me!”

verses.html:
2
Jesus calls us from the worship
Of the vain world’s golden store,
From each idol that would keep us
Saying, “Christian, love me more.”
verses.updatedHtml:
2
Jesus calls us from the worship
Of the vain world’s golden store,
From each idol that would keep us
Saying, “Christian, love me more.”

verses.html:
3
In our joys and in our sorrows,
Days of toil and hours of ease,
Still He calls, in cares and pleasures, “Christian, love me more than these.”
verses.updatedHtml:
3
In our joys and in our sorrows,

verses.html:
4
Jesus calls us: by Thy mercies,
Saviour, may we hear Thy call,
Give our hearts to Thine obedience,
Serve and love Thee best of all.
verses.updatedHtml:
4
Jesus calls us: by Thy mercies,

verses.html:
1
Immortal, invisible, God only wise,
In light inaccessible hid from our eyes,
Most blessed, most glorious, the Ancient of Days,
Almighty, victorious, Thy great name we praise.
verses.updatedHtml:
1
Immortal, invisible, God only wise,

Almighty, victorious, Thy great name we praise.

verses.html:
2
Unresting, unhasting, and silent as light.
Nor wanting, nor wasting, Thou rulest in might.
Thy justice like mountains high soaring above
Thy clouds, which are fountains of goodness and love.
verses.updatedHtml:
2

verses.html:
3
To all, life Thou givest, to both great and small;
In all life Thou livest, the true life of all;
We blossom and flourish as leaves on the tree,
And wither and perish but naught changeth Thee.

I’ll sail the wide seas no more;
The tempest may sweep over wild, stormy, deep,
In Jesus I’m safe evermore.

hymns.title: Angels, from the Realms of Glory

verses.html:
1
Angels, from the realms of glory,
Wing your flight o’er all the earth;
Ye who sang creation’s story,
Now proclaim Messiah’s birth:
Come and worship, come and worship,
Worship Christ, the newborn King!
verses.updatedHtml:
1

Now proclaim Messiah’s birth:
Come and worship, come and worship,
Worship Christ, the newborn King!

verses.html:
2
Shepherds, in the fields abiding,
Watching o’er your flocks by night,
God with man is now residing,
Yonder shines the infant Light:
Come and worship, come and worship,
Worship Christ, the newborn King!
verses.updatedHtml:
2
Shepherds, in the fields abiding,

Yonder shines the infant Light:
Come and worship, come and worship,
Worship Christ, the newborn King!

verses.html:
3
Sages, leave your contemplations,
Brighter visions beam afar;
Seek the great Desire of nations,
Ye have seen His natal star:
Come and worship, come and worship,
Worship Christ, the newborn King!
verses.updatedHtml:
3
Sages, leave your contemplations,

verses.html:
4
Saints, before the alter bending,
Watching long in hope and fear,
Suddenly the Lord, descending,
In His temple shall appear:
Come and worship, come and worship,
Worship Christ, the newborn King!

hymns.title: Angels We Have Heard on High

verses.html:
1
Angels we have heard on high,
Sweetly singing o’er the plains:
And the mountains in reply,
Echoing their joyous strains.
Gloria in excelsis Deo!
Gloria in excelsis Deo!
verses.updatedHtml:
1
Angels we have heard on high,

And the mountains in reply,
Echoing their joyous strains.
Gloria in excelsis Deo!
Gloria in excelsis Deo!

verses.html:
2
Shepherds, why this jubilee?
Why your joyous strains prolong?
What the gladsome tidings be
Which inspire your heav’nly song?
Gloria in excelsis Deo!
Gloria in excelsis Deo!
verses.updatedHtml:
2
Shepherds, why this jubilee?

Gloria in excelsis Deo!

verses.html:
3
Come to Bethlehem, and see
Him whose birth the angels sing;
Come, adore on bended knee
Christ the Lord, the newborn King.
Gloria in excelsis Deo!
Gloria in excelsis Deo!
verses.updatedHtml:
3
Come to Bethlehem, and see

Gloria in excelsis Deo!

verses.html:
4

Whom the choirs of angels praise;

While our hearts in love we raise.
Gloria in excelsis Deo!
Gloria in excelsis Deo!

Praise is His gracious choice:
Alleluia! Amen!

verses.html:
1
Crown Him with many crowns,
The Lamb upon His throne;
Hark! how the heavenly anthem drowns
All music but its own:
Awake, my soul, and sing
Of Him who died for thee,
And hail Him as thy matchless King
Through all eternity.
verses.updatedHtml:
1

And hail Him as thy matchless King
Through all eternity.

verses.html:
2
Crown Him the Lord of life,
Who triumphed o’er the grave,
And rose victorious in the strife
For those He came to save;
His glories now we sing
Who died, and rose on high,
Who died eternal life to bring,
And lives that death may die.
verses.updatedHtml:
2

verses.html:
3
Crown Him the Lord of peace,
Whose power a scepter sways
From pole to pole, that wars may cease,
And all be prayer and praise:
His reign shall know no end,
And round His pierced feet
Fair flowers of paradise extend
Their fragrance ever sweet.

Thy praise and glory shall not fail
Throughout eternity.

So precious is Jesus, my Saviour, my King,
His praise all the day long with rapture I sing;
To Him in my weakness for strength I can cling,
For He is so precious to me.

hymns.title: Break Thou the Bread of Life

verses.html:
1
Break Thou the bread of life,
Dear Lord, to me,
As Thou didst break the loaves
Beside the sea;
Beyond the sacred page
I seek thee, Lord;
My spirit pants for Thee,
O living Word.

verses.html:
1
O sacred Head, now wounded,
With grief and shame weighed down,
Now scornfully surrounded With thorns,
Thine only crown;
How pale Thou art with anguish,
With sore abuse and scorn!
How does that visage languish,
Which once was bright as morn!
verses.updatedHtml:
1
O sacred Head, now wounded,
With grief and shame weighed down,
Now scornfully surrounded With thorns,
Thine only crown;
How pale Thou art with anguish,
With sore abuse and scorn!
How does that visage languish,
Which once was bright as morn!

verses.html:
2
What Thou, my Lord, hast suffered
Was all for sinners’ gain:
Mine, mine was the transgression,
But Thine the deadly pain;
Lo, here I fall, my Saviour! ’Tis I deserve Thy place,
Look on me with Thy favor,
Vouch safe to me Thy grace.
verses.updatedHtml:
2
What Thou, my Lord, hast suffered
Was all for sinners’ gain:
Mine, mine was the transgression,
But Thine the deadly pain;
Lo, here I fall, my Saviour! ’Tis I deserve Thy place,
Look on me with Thy favor,
Vouch safe to me Thy grace.

verses.html:
3
What language shall I borrow
To thank Thee, dearest Friend,
For this Thy dying sorrow,
Thy pity without end?
O make me Thine forever,
And should I fainting be,
Lord, let me never, never
Out live my love to Thee.

hymns.title: His Eye Is on the Sparrow

verses.html:
1
Why should I feel discouraged,
Why should the shadows come,
Why should my heart be lonely
And long for Heav’n and home,
When Jesus is my portion?
My constant Friend is He:
His eye is on the sparrow,
And I know He watches me.
verses.updatedHtml:
1
Why should I feel discouraged,
Why should the shadows come,
Why should my heart be lonely
And long for Heav’n and home,
When Jesus is my portion?
My constant Friend is He:
His eye is on the sparrow,
And I know He watches me.

verses.label: 1C
verses.html:
1
His eye is on the sparrow,
And I know He watches me.
I sing because I’m happy,
I sing because I’m free.
For His eye is on the sparrow,
and I know He watches me.
verses.updatedHtml:
1
His eye is on the sparrow,
And I know He watches me.
I sing because I’m happy,
I sing because I’m free.
For His eye is on the sparrow,
and I know He watches me.

verses.html:
2
“Let not your heart be troubled,”
His tender word I hear,
And resting on His goodness,
I lose my doubts and fears,
Tho’ by the path He leadeth
But one step I may see:
His eye is on the sparrow,
And I know He watches me.

verses.html:
1
O Zion, haste, thy mission, high fulfilling,
To tell to all the world that God is Light;
That He who made all nations is not willing
One soul should perish, lost in shades of night.
Publish glad tidings, tidings of peace,
Tidings of Jesus, redemption and release.
verses.updatedHtml:
1
O Zion, haste, thy mission, high fulfilling,
To tell to all the world that God is Light;
That He who made all nations is not willing
One soul should perish, lost in shades of night.
Publish glad tidings, tidings of peace,
Tidings of Jesus, redemption and release.

verses.html:
2
Behold how many thousands still are lying,
Bound in the dark some prison house of sin,
With none to tell them of the Saviour’s dying,
Or of the life He died for them to win.
Publish glad tidings, tidings of peace,
Tidings of Jesus, redemption and release.
verses.updatedHtml:
2

Publish glad tidings, tidings of peace,
Tidings of Jesus, redemption and release.

verses.html:
3
Proclaim to ev’ry poeple, tongue, and nation
The God, in whom they live and move, is Love:
Tell how He stoop’d to save His lost creation,
And died on earth that man might live above.
Publish glad tidings, tidings of peace,
Tidings of Jesus, redemption and release.

And all thou spendest Jesus will repay.
Publish glad tidings, tidings of peace,
Tidings of Jesus, redemption and release.

verses.html:

In the hour of trial,
Jesus plead for me;
Lest, by base denial,
I depart from Thee;
When Thou see’st me waver,
With a look recall;
Nor for fear or favor
Suffer me to fall.

verses.html:
2
With forbidden pleasures
Would this vain world charm;
Or its sordid treasures
Spread to work me harm;
Bring to my remembrance
Sad Gethsemane,
Or, in darker semblance,
Cross crowned Calvary.
verses.updatedHtml:

Sorrow, toil, and woe;
Or should pain at tend me
On my path below;
Grant that I may never
Fail Thy hand to see;
Grant that I may ever
Cast my care on Thee.

To eternal life.

verses.html:
1
Lead on, O King Eternal,
The day of march has come;
Henceforth in fields of conquest
Thy tents shall be our home;
Through days of preparation
Thy grace has made us strong,
And now, O King Eternal,
We lift out battle song.

verses.html:
2
Lead on, O King Eternal,
Till sin’s fierce war shall cease,
And holiness shall whisper
The sweet amen of peace.
For not with swords’ loud clashing,
Nor roll of stirring drums;
With deeds of love and mercy
The heav’nly kingdom comes.

Lead on, O God of might.

hymns.title: Come, Oh Come, with Thy Broken Heart

verses.html:
1
Come, oh come, with thy broken heart,
Weary and worn with care;
Come and kneel at the open door,
Jesus is waiting there:
Waiting to heal thy wounded soul,
Waiting to give thee rest:
Why wilt thou walk where shadows fall?
Come to His loving breast!
verses.updatedHtml:
1

Jesus is waiting there:
Waiting to heal thy wounded soul,
Waiting to give thee rest:
Why wilt thou walk where shadows fall?
Come to His loving breast!

verses.html:
2
Firmly cling to the blessed cross,
There shall thy refuge be;
Wash thee now in the crimson fount,
Flowing so pure for thee:
List to the gentle warning voice!
List to the earnest call!
Leave at the cross thy burden now:
Jesus will bear it all.
verses.updatedHtml:
2

verses.html:
3
Come and taste of the precious feast,
Feast of eternal love;
Think of joys that forever bloom,
Bright in the life above:
Come with a trusting heart to God,
Come and be saved by grace:
Come, for He longs to clasp thee now
Close in His dear embrace.

Yielding allegiance, glad hearted and free,
This is the pathway of blessing for me.

verses.label: 1C
verses.html:
1
O Jesus, Lord and Saviour,
I give myself to Thee;
For Thou, in Thine atonement,
Didst give Thyself for me;
I own no other Master,
My heart shall be Thy throne;
My life I give, henceforth to live,
O Christ, for Thee alone.

verses.html:

Living for Jesus who died in my place,
Bearing on Calv’ry my sin and disgrace,
Such love constrains me to answer His call,
Follow His leading and give Him my all.
